node.statement: MAIN INEQUALITY. Assuming the Chain Rule (node 1.6), with u_k = H_p(lambda_{sigma(k)}), v_k = H_q(mu_{tau(k)}), h_k = H_r(nu_k), and alpha_k, beta_k as correction terms satisfying h = u - alpha = v - beta: the target inequality ||u||^2 ||v||^2 >= ||h||^2 (||u||^2 + ||v||^2) holds, which is equivalent to 1/Phi_n(r) >= 1/Phi_n(p) + 1/Phi_n(q).
